Hello, my name is Antonio, I am an NLP researcher at an academic institution.
I agree that most of the research in explainable NLP has been on the wrong track. The focus has mainly been on interpretability metrics which provide "local" explanations that are not satisfactory for complex models and tasks. We need to develop models with inherent interpretability where explanations are part of the model design. I am particularly interested in knowledge-infused and modular neural architectures for this purpose. In my free time I enjoy reading, playing guitar and watching movies. The majority of research in building explainable models published in the last 5 years is on the wrong track.

Choices:
 (A) Agree
